text_english: Read in the name of your Lord who created.
world_events: Byzantine-Persian Wars ongoing.

text_english: Created man from a clot of blood.
world_events: Mecca was a major trade hub.

text_english: Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous.
world_events: Persians fighting Romans.

text_english: Who taught by the pen.
context: Emphasizing importance of writing and knowledge.
world_events: Arabia was largely oral-based society.

text_english: Taught man that which he knew not.
world_events: Silk Road trade was flourishing.

text_english: O you who covers himself [with a garment],
world_events: Tribal customs were strong.

text_english: Arise and warn
world_events: Polytheism was widespread.

text_english: And magnify your Lord.
world_events: Mecca was a polytheistic city.

text_english: And purify your garments.
context: Call to spiritual and physical cleanliness.
world_events: Religious rituals were a core part of Arabian culture.

text_english: And avoid uncleanliness.
context: Command to avoid idolatry and sins.
world_events: Kaaba housed many idols at the time.

text_english: And do not confer favor to acquire more.
world_events: Arabian society was driven by wealth accumulation.

text_english: He will burn in a Fire of blazing flame.
context: A warning to those who opposed the Prophet.
world_events: Polytheists controlled the Kaaba.

text_english: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
context: Opening of the Quran, a universal prayer.
world_events: Early revelations focus on monotheism.

text_english: Praise be to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.
world_events: Christian and Zoroastrian faiths dominated Persia and Rome.

text_english: The Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.
world_events: Arab society valued tribal power over mercy.

text_english: Master of the Day of Judgment.
context: Introduction of life after death as a fundamental belief.
world_events: Many Arabian tribes practiced ancestor worship.

text_english: You alone we worship, and You alone we ask for help.
world_events: Idol worship was dominant in Arabia.

text_english: Guide us on the straight path.
world_events: Religious and ethical conflicts in Arabian tribes.

text_arabic: صِرَاطَ الَّذِينَ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَيْهِمْ غَيْرِ الْمَغْضُوبِ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا الضَّالِّينَ
text_english: The path of those who have received Your grace; not the path of those who have brought down wrath upon themselves, nor of those who have gone astray.
context: A prayer for guidance and righteousness.
world_events: Early Muslims faced opposition.

text_english: Perish the hands of Abu Lahab, and perish he!
context: Condemnation of Prophet Muhammad’s uncle for his opposition.
world_events: Hostility from Quraysh tribe increased.

text_arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ
text_english: His wealth and whatever he earned will not avail him.
world_events: Wealth and lineage were dominant social values.

text_english: He will burn in a Fire of blazing flame.
context: A warning to those who opposed the Prophet.
world_events: Polytheists controlled the Kaaba.

text_english: And his wife, the carrier of firewood.
context: His wife Umm Jamil also opposed Islam.
world_events: Quraysh leaders resisted Islam.

text_english: Around her neck is a rope of palm fiber.
world_events: Opposition to Islam grew stronger.

text_english: When the sun is wrapped up in darkness.
context: Description of the Day of Judgment.
world_events: Arab tribes believed in various gods.

text_english: And when the stars fall, dispersing.
world_events: Astronomy was important in Arabian culture.

text_english: And when the mountains are set in motion.
world_events: Arabian Peninsula was mostly desert.

text_english: And when pregnant camels are neglected.
context: Material wealth will be meaningless on Judgment Day.
world_events: Camels were the backbone of trade.

text_english: And when the wild beasts are gathered.
world_events: Wild animals were feared in Arabia.

text_english: And when the seas are filled with flame.
world_events: Trade routes connected Arabia by sea.

text_english: By the night as it envelops.
world_events: Meccans followed lunar calendars.

text_english: And by the day when it shines in brightness.
context: Contrast of night and day as divine signs.
world_events: Sun worship was common in Arabia.

text_english: And by Him Who created the male and the female.
world_events: Gender roles were strictly defined in Arabian society.

text_english: Verily, your efforts are diverse.
context: People take different paths in life.
world_events: Mecca was a center of trade and commerce.

text_english: As for him who gives and fears Allah.
world_events: Charity was highly regarded in Arab culture.

text_english: And believes in the best reward.
world_events: Many Arabian tribes believed in fate rather than accountability.

text_english: We will make smooth for him the path of ease.
world_events: Islam was beginning to take shape as a distinct movement.

text_english: But as for him who is miserly and considers himself self-sufficient.
world_events: The Quraysh elite resisted Muhammad's message.

text_english: And denies the best reward.
world_events: Early Muslims faced persecution.

text_english: We will make smooth for him the path of difficulty.
world_events: Tensions in Mecca were rising.

text_english: By the morning brightness.
context: Reassurance after a period of no revelation.
world_events: Prophet Muhammad experienced a temporary pause in revelation.

text_english: And by the night when it covers with darkness.
context: Contrast of light and darkness as metaphors.
world_events: Arabian society was heavily influenced by lunar cycles.

text_english: Your Lord has not forsaken you, nor is He displeased.
context: Reassurance that Allah had not abandoned the Prophet.
world_events: Prophet Muhammad was facing immense opposition.

text_english: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first life.
context: Promise of a greater reward in the afterlife.
world_events: Many Meccans focused only on material wealth.

text_english: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
context: Assurance that Prophet Muhammad will be rewarded.
world_events: Early Muslims suffered economic and social boycotts.

text_english: Did We not expand for you, [O Muhammad], your breast?
context: Comfort and reassurance to the Prophet Muhammad.
world_events: Islam continued to face resistance from the Quraysh.

text_english: And We removed from you your burden
context: Relief from distress and burden given by Allah.
world_events: Prophet Muhammad's message continued to spread despite opposition.

text_english: Which had weighed upon your back
context: Symbolizing the difficulties faced by the Prophet.
world_events: Mecca remained divided between supporters and opponents of Islam.

text_english: And raised high for you your repute.
context: Promise of increased honor for the Prophet Muhammad.
world_events: Islam's message slowly gained traction in Mecca.

text_english: By the fig and the olive
context: Swearing by the fig and olive as symbols of blessings.
world_events: Trade routes remained crucial in Arabian Peninsula.

text_english: And [by] Mount Sinai,
context: Reference to the sacred Mount Sinai where Prophet Musa (Moses) received revelation.
world_events: Islamic teachings started to address earlier prophetic traditions.

text_english: And this secure city [Mecca],
context: Reference to Mecca as a sacred and safe place.
world_events: Mecca was a religious and economic center in the Arabian Peninsula.

text_arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ فِىٓ أَحْسَنِ تَقْوِيمٍ
text_english: We have certainly created man in the best of stature,
context: Affirmation of human dignity and purpose.
world_events: Teachings on human value and purpose contrasted with tribal customs.

text_english: Then We return him to the lowest of the low,
world_events: The Quraysh elite resisted Prophet Muhammad's call to righteousness.

text_arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمْ أَجْرٌ غَيْرُ مَمْنُونٍ
text_english: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
context: Promise of eternal reward for the faithful.
world_events: Early Muslims remained steadfast despite persecution.

text_english: So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?
context: Questioning those who deny divine judgment.
world_events: Many Meccans denied the concept of resurrection.

text_english: Is not Allah the most just of judges?
world_events: Tribal justice systems dominated Arabian society.

text_english: For the accustomed security of the Quraysh -
context: Addressing the privileged position of the Quraysh tribe.
world_events: Quraysh were the dominant tribe in Mecca.

text_english: Their accustomed security in the caravan of winter and summer -
world_events: Trade caravans were vital to Meccan economy.

text_english: Let them worship the Lord of this House,
context: Call to worship Allah, the Lord of the Kaaba.
world_events: Kaaba was a major pilgrimage site.

text_arabic: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٍ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنْ خَوْفٍۭ
text_english: Who has fed them against hunger and made them safe from fear.
context: Reminder of Allah's blessings upon Quraysh.
world_events: Mecca enjoyed special status as a sacred city.

text_english: The Striking Calamity -
context: Introduction to the Day of Judgment.
world_events: Many Arabs were skeptical of the afterlife.

text_english: What is the Striking Calamity?
context: Emphasis on the gravity of Judgment Day.
world_events: Polytheistic beliefs dominated Arabian society.

text_english: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
context: Building suspense about the Day of Judgment.
world_events: People were focused on worldly pursuits.

text_english: It is the Day when people will be like scattered moths,
context: Description of chaos on Judgment Day.
world_events: Arabs were familiar with desert moth swarms.

text_english: And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.
context: Description of mountains on Judgment Day.
world_events: Mountains were seen as permanent landmarks.

text_english: Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
context: The weighing of deeds on Judgment Day.
world_events: Trade relied heavily on accurate weighing.

text_english: He will be in a pleasant life.
world_events: Life in Arabia was often harsh and difficult.

text_english: But as for one whose scales are light,
world_events: Social status was based on wealth and tribal connections.

text_english: His refuge will be an abyss.
world_events: Desert pits were feared in Arabian culture.

text_english: And what can make you know what that is?
world_events: Fear of the unknown was common in society.

text_english: It is a Fire, intensely hot.
world_events: Desert heat was well understood by Arabs.

text_english: I swear by the Day of Resurrection
context: Oath emphasizing the reality of resurrection.
world_events: Many denied the possibility of resurrection.

text_english: And I swear by the reproaching soul
world_events: Moral consciousness was being awakened.

text_english: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
world_events: Scientific understanding was limited.

text_arabic: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّىَ بَنَانَهُۥ
text_english: Yes, We are able to proportion even his fingertips.
context: Demonstration of Allah's power over creation.
world_events: Understanding of human anatomy was basic.

text_english: But man wishes to continue in sin.
world_events: Moral corruption was widespread.

text_english: Woe to every scorner and mocker,
context: Condemnation of those who mock others.
world_events: Social mockery was common in Meccan society.

text_english: Who collects wealth and continuously counts it.
world_events: Wealth accumulation was a status symbol.

text_english: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
context: False sense of security from wealth.
world_events: Rich merchants dominated Meccan society.

text_english: No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.
world_events: The wealthy often oppressed the poor.

text_english: And what can make you know what that is?
world_events: Fear tactics were common in Arab society.

text_english: It is the fire of Allah, [eternally] fueled,
world_events: Fire was both feared and revered in desert culture.

text_english: Which mounts directed at the hearts.
world_events: Heart disease was poorly understood.

text_english: Indeed, it will be closed down upon them
world_events: Imprisonment was a common punishment.

text_english: In extended columns.
world_events: Columns were symbols of power in architecture.

text_english: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
world_events: Desert winds were significant in Arabian life.

text_english: And the winds that blow violently
context: Continuation of oath by natural forces.
world_events: Sandstorms were common in Arabia.

text_english: And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
world_events: Rain was vital for desert agriculture.

text_english: And those [angels] who bring criterion
context: Angels as bearers of divine messages.
world_events: Belief in supernatural beings was common.

text_english: And those [angels] who deliver a message
world_events: Various forms of soothsaying existed.

text_english: As justification or warning,
world_events: Warnings were often delivered by tribal messengers.

text_english: Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
world_events: Promises and oaths were highly valued in Arab culture.

text_english: So when the stars are obliterated
context: Signs of the Day of Judgment.
world_events: Stars were used for navigation in desert.

text_english: And when the heaven is split open
world_events: Astronomical events were considered omens.

text_english: And when the mountains are blown away
world_events: Mountains were symbols of permanence.

text_english: And when the messengers' time has come
context: Assembly of prophets on Judgment Day.
world_events: Prophetic traditions were important in Arabia.

text_english: For what Day was it postponed?
world_events: People questioned the timing of divine judgment.

text_english: For the Day of Decision.
context: Answer about the Day of Judgment.
world_events: Tribal disputes required decisive judgments.

text_english: And what can make you know what is the Day of Decision?
context: Emphasizing the gravity of Judgment Day.
world_events: Major decisions were made by tribal councils.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
context: Warning to those who deny the truth.
world_events: Many Meccans rejected the message of Islam.

text_english: Did We not destroy the former peoples?
world_events: Ancient ruins were visible in Arabia.

text_english: Then We will follow them with the later ones.
context: Warning of similar fate for later generations.
world_events: Stories of destroyed nations were common.

text_english: Thus do We deal with the criminals.
world_events: Crime and punishment were tribal matters.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
world_events: Denial persisted despite clear signs.

text_english: Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
world_events: Understanding of human reproduction was basic.

text_english: And We placed it in a firm lodging
world_events: Medical knowledge was limited.

text_english: For a known extent.
context: Reference to predetermined period of pregnancy.
world_events: Pregnancy and childbirth were significant events.

text_english: And We determined [it], and excellent are We to determine.
world_events: Belief in fate was strong in Arab culture.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
context: Repeated warning after evidence of Allah's power.
world_events: Denial persisted despite clear signs.

text_english: Is not Allah the most just of judges?
world_events: Tribal justice systems dominated Arabian society.

text_english: Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
world_events: Understanding of human reproduction was basic.

text_english: And We placed it in a firm lodging
world_events: Medical knowledge was limited.

text_english: For a known extent.
context: Reference to predetermined period of pregnancy.
world_events: Pregnancy and childbirth were significant events.

text_english: And We determined [it], and excellent are We to determine.
world_events: Belief in fate was strong in Arab culture.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
world_events: Some denied divine origin of natural resources.

text_arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
text_english: Proceed to that which you used to deny.
world_events: Mockery of divine warnings was common.

text_arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰ ظِلٍّ ذِى ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٍ
text_english: Proceed to a shadow having three columns
world_events: Desert heat made shade valuable.

text_arabic: لَّا ظَلِيلٍ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ
text_english: No shade of coolness and availing not against the flame
world_events: Shade was crucial for desert survival.

text_english: Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
world_events: Fortresses were symbols of might.

text_english: As if they were yellow camels.
world_events: Camels were vital to Arab life.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
world_events: Fear was used to encourage moral behavior.

text_english: This is the Day they will not speak,
context: Silence of the guilty on Judgment Day.
world_events: Eloquence was highly valued in Arab society.

text_english: Nor will it be permitted for them to make excuses.
context: No opportunity for excuses on Judgment Day.
world_events: Tribal customs allowed for mediation and excuses.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
world_events: Denial of divine judgment was widespread.

text_english: This is the Day of Decision; We have gathered you and the former peoples.
world_events: Arabs valued ancestral connections.

text_english: So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
context: Challenge to those who plot against truth.
world_events: Plotting against Muslims was common.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
world_events: Opposition to Islam continued to grow.

text_english: Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
world_events: Shade and water were precious in desert life.

text_english: And fruits from whatever they desire,
world_events: Fruits were rare luxuries in desert.

text_arabic: كُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ هَنِيٓـًٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
text_english: Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do.
world_events: Food and drink were signs of prosperity.

text_english: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
world_events: Good deeds were valued in tribal culture.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
world_events: Many rejected descriptions of paradise.

text_english: Eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
context: Warning to those who indulge in worldly pleasures.
world_events: Wealthy Meccans lived in luxury.

text_english: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
context: Warning after mentioning temporary nature of worldly pleasures.
world_events: Material wealth was a source of pride.

text_arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرْكَعُوا۟ لَا يَرْكَعُونَ
text_english: And when it is said to them, 'Bow,' they do not bow.
world_events: Pride prevented many from accepting Islam.

text_english: Qaf. By the honored Qur'an.
world_events: Arabs were familiar with oath-taking.

text_arabic: بَلْ عَجِبُوٓا۟ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٌ مِّنْهُمْ فَقَالَ ٱلْكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا شَىْءٌ عَجِيبٌ
text_english: But they wonder that there has come to them a warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say, 'This is an amazing thing.'
context: Disbelievers' surprise at a human messenger.
world_events: People expected divine messengers to be supernatural.

text_arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا ۖ ذَٰلِكَ رَجْعٌۢ بَعِيدٌ
text_english: When we have died and have become dust, [will we return to life]? That is a distant return.
world_events: Concept of resurrection was foreign to many.

text_arabic: قَدْ عَلِمْنَا مَا تَنقُصُ ٱلْأَرْضُ مِنْهُمْ ۖ وَعِندَنَا كِتَٰبٌ حَفِيظٌۢ
text_english: We know what the earth diminishes of them, and with Us is a retaining record.
world_events: Record-keeping was important in trade.

text_arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِىٓ أَمْرٍ مَّرِيجٍ
text_english: But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.
context: State of those who reject truth.
world_events: Confusion about religious truth was common.

text_arabic: أَفَلَمْ يَنظُرُوٓا۟ إِلَى ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ فَوْقَهُمْ كَيْفَ بَنَيْنَٰهَا وَزَيَّنَّٰهَا وَمَا لَهَا مِن فُرُوجٍ
text_english: Have they not looked at the heaven above them - how We structured it and adorned it and [how] it has no rifts?
world_events: Arabs were skilled in celestial navigation.

text_arabic: وَٱلْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَٰهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۭ بَهِيجٍ
text_english: And the earth - We spread it out and cast therein firmly set mountains and made grow therein [something] of every beautiful kind,
world_events: Desert dwellers appreciated plant life.

text_english: Giving insight and a reminder for every servant who turns [to Allah].
world_events: Nature was seen as divine artwork.

text_arabic: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً مُّبَٰرَكًا فَأَنۢبَتْنَا بِهِۦ جَنَّٰتٍ وَحَبَّ ٱلْحَصِيدِ
text_english: And We have sent down blessed rain from the sky and made grow thereby gardens and grain from the harvest
world_events: Rain was vital for desert agriculture.

text_english: And lofty palm trees having fruit arranged in layers -
world_events: Dates were staple food in Arabia.

text_arabic: رِّزْقًا لِّلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِۦ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْخُرُوجُ
text_english: As provision for the servants, and We have given life thereby to a dead land. Thus is the resurrection.
world_events: Desert revival after rain was common.

text_arabic: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
text_english: The people of Noah denied before them, and the companions of the well and Thamud
world_events: Stories of ancient peoples were known.

text_english: And 'Aad and Pharaoh and the brothers of Lot
world_events: Stories of these nations circulated in Arabia.

text_arabic: وَأَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍ ۚ كُلٌّ كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
text_english: And the companions of the thicket and the people of Tubba'. All denied the messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.
world_events: Yemen was ruled by Tubba' dynasty.

text_arabic: أَفَعَيِينَا بِٱلْخَلْقِ ٱلْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى لَبْسٍ مِّنْ خَلْقٍ جَدِيدٍ
text_english: Did We fail in the first creation? But they are in confusion about a new creation.
world_events: People doubted possibility of resurrection.

text_arabic: لَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَٰنَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِۦ نَفْسُهُۥ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ ٱلْوَرِيدِ
text_english: And We have already created man and know what his soul whispers to him, and We are closer to him than [his] jugular vein
world_events: Medical knowledge included blood vessels.

text_arabic: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى ٱلْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌ
text_english: When the two receivers receive, seated on the right and on the left.
world_events: Record-keeping was a respected profession.

text_arabic: مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌ
text_english: Man does not utter any word except that with him is an observer prepared [to record].
world_events: Oral traditions were carefully preserved.

text_arabic: جَآءَتْ سَكْرَةُ ٱلْمَوْتِ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
text_english: The intoxication of death will bring the truth; that is what you were trying to avoid.
world_events: Death was a frequent reality in harsh desert life.

text_arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِى ٱلصُّورِ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْوَعِيدِ
text_english: And the Horn will be blown. That is the Day of [carrying out] the threat.
world_events: Horns were used for important announcements.

text_arabic: وَجَآءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّعَهَا سَآئِقٌ وَشَهِيدٌ
text_english: And every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.
world_events: Court systems required witnesses.

text_arabic: لَّقَدْ كُنتَ فِى غَفْلَةٍ مِّنْ هَٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنكَ غِطَآءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌ
text_english: You were certainly in unmindfulness of this, and We have removed from you your cover, so your sight, this Day, is sharp.
world_events: Material wealth often caused negligence.

text_arabic: قَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لَكُمْ وَكُنتُم بِهِۦ تُشَٰكُّونَ
text_english: His companion will say, 'This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allah] and keeper [of His covenant]'
world_events: Record-keeping was crucial in trade.

text_arabic: أَلْقِيَا فِى جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍ
text_english: [Allah will say], 'Throw into Hell every obstinate disbeliever,'
world_events: Punishment was public in Arabia.

text_english: Preventer of good, transgressor, doubter,
world_events: Wealthy often prevented charity.

text_arabic: ٱلَّذِىٓ أَخْرَجَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلشَّدِيدِ
text_english: Who made [as equal] with Allah another deity; then throw him into the severe punishment.
world_events: Idol worship was widespread.

text_arabic: قَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ رَبَّنَا مَآ أَطْغَيْتُهُۥ وَلَٰكِن كَانَ فِى ضَلَٰلٍۭ بَعِيدٍ
text_english: His companion will say, 'Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself] was in extreme error.'
world_events: Tribal loyalty was highly valued.

text_arabic: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا۟ لَدَىَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُم بِٱلْوَعِيدِ
text_english: [Allah] will say, 'Do not dispute before Me, while I had already presented to you the warning.'
world_events: Disputes were common in tribal society.

text_arabic: مَا يُبَدَّلُ ٱلْقَوْلُ لَدَىَّ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِظَلَّٰمٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
text_english: The word will not be changed with Me, and never will I be unjust to the servants.
world_events: Tribal leaders could change judgments.

text_arabic: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ ٱمْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِن مَّزِيدٍ
text_english: On the Day We will say to Hell, 'Have you been filled?' and it will say, 'Are there some more,'
world_events: Desert wells could run dry.

text_english: And Paradise will be brought near to the righteous, not far,
world_events: Long journeys were common in trade.

text_arabic: هَٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍ
text_english: [It will be said], 'This is what you were promised - for every returner [to Allah] and keeper [of His covenant]'
world_events: Covenant-keeping was highly valued.

text_arabic: مَّنْ خَشِىَ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنَ بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَجَآءَ بِقَلْبٍ مُّنِيبٍ
text_english: Who feared the Most Merciful unseen and came with a heart returning [in repentance].
world_events: Fear of unseen powers was common.

text_english: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity.
world_events: Peace was valued in tribal conflicts.

text_arabic: لَهُم مَّا يَشَآءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌ
text_english: They will have whatever they wish therein, and with Us is more.
world_events: Scarcity was common in desert life.

text_arabic: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًا فَنَقَّبُوا۟ فِى ٱلْبِلَٰدِ هَلْ مِن مَّحِيصٍ
text_english: And how many generations before them did We destroy who were greater than them in [striking] power and had explored throughout the lands. Is there any place of escape?
world_events: Ruins of ancient civilizations were visible.

text_arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُۥ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى ٱلسَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌ
text_english: Indeed in that is a reminder for whoever has a heart or who listens while he is present [in mind].
world_events: Oral transmission was primary mode of learning.

text_arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٍ
text_english: And We did certainly create the heavens and earth and what is between them in six days, and there touched Us no weariness.
world_events: Physical labor caused fatigue in humans.

text_arabic: فَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ ٱلْغُرُوبِ
text_english: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting,
world_events: Sun's position marked prayer times.

text_english: And [in part] of the night exalt Him and after prostration.
world_events: Night was time for reflection.

text_arabic: وَٱسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ ٱلْمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٍ قَرِيبٍ
text_english: And listen on the Day when the Caller will call out from a place nearby -
world_events: Town criers made important announcements.

text_arabic: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ ٱلصَّيْحَةَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْخُرُوجِ
text_english: The Day they will hear the blast [of the Horn] in truth. That is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].
world_events: Horns signaled important events.

text_arabic: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا ٱلْمَصِيرُ
text_english: Indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the destination.
context: Divine control over life and death.
world_events: Life and death were daily realities.

text_arabic: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌ
text_english: On the Day the earth breaks away from them [they will emerge] rapidly; that is a gathering easy for Us.
world_events: Desert ground could split in extreme heat.

text_arabic: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِجَبَّارٍ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِٱلْقُرْءَانِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
text_english: We are most knowing of what they say, and you are not over them a tyrant. But remind by the Qur'an whoever fears My threat.
world_events: Some leaders were tyrannical.

text_english: I swear by this city -
context: Oath by Mecca, the sacred city.
world_events: Mecca was a significant trade center.

text_english: And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -
world_events: Prophet faced opposition in Mecca.

text_english: And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],
world_events: Family lineage was highly valued.

text_english: We have certainly created man into hardship.
world_events: Life was challenging in desert environment.

text_arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
text_english: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
world_events: Wealthy Meccans felt invincible.

text_english: He says, 'I have spent wealth in abundance.'
world_events: Trade brought wealth to some Meccans.

text_english: Does he think that no one has seen him?
world_events: Secret transactions were common in trade.

text_english: Have We not made for him two eyes?
world_events: Basic human faculties were recognized as blessings.

text_english: And a tongue and two lips?
world_events: Speech was highly valued in Arab culture.

text_english: And have shown him the two ways?
world_events: Moral decisions faced in trade and tribal life.

text_english: But he has not broken through the difficult pass.
world_events: Mountain passes were challenging for travelers.

text_english: And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
world_events: Difficult decisions faced in tribal life.

text_english: It is the freeing of a slave
world_events: Slavery was common in Arabia.

text_arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَامٌ فِى يَوْمٍ ذِى مَسْغَبَةٍ
text_english: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
world_events: Famines occurred in desert climate.

text_english: An orphan of near relationship
world_events: Wars left many orphans.

text_english: Or a needy person in misery
world_events: Poverty existed despite trade wealth.

text_arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْمَرْحَمَةِ
text_english: And being among those who have believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
world_events: Early Muslims faced persecution.

text_english: Those are the companions of the right.
world_events: Right side symbolized good fortune.

text_arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
text_english: But those who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.
world_events: Left side symbolized misfortune.

text_english: Over them will be fire closed in.
world_events: Desert heat was most feared punishment.

text_english: By the sun and the morning brightness
world_events: Stars guided desert travelers.

text_english: And by the stars and the stars
world_events: Stars were used for navigation.

text_english: And by the stars and the stars
world_events: Stars were used for navigation.

text_arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ لَّمَّا عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ
text_english: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
world_events: Guards protected caravans.

text_english: So let man observe from what he was created -
world_events: Basic understanding of reproduction existed.

text_english: He was created from a fluid, ejected,
world_events: Limited medical knowledge existed.

text_english: Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
world_events: Basic anatomy was known.

text_english: Indeed, Allah, to return him [to life], is Able.
world_events: Belief in afterlife varied among Arabs.

text_english: The Day when secrets will be put on trial,
world_events: Secret alliances were common.

text_arabic: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٍ وَلَا نَاصِرٍ
text_english: Then man will have no power or any helper.
world_events: Tribal protection was vital.

text_english: By the sky which returns [rain]
world_events: Rain was vital for desert life.

text_english: And [by] the earth which cracks open [for plants]
world_events: Agriculture depended on soil fertility.

text_english: Indeed, the Qur'an is a decisive statement,
world_events: Poetry was highly valued.

text_english: And it is not amusement.
world_events: Entertainment through poetry was common.

text_english: Indeed, they are planning a plan,
world_events: Plots against early Muslims increased.

text_english: But I am planning a plan.
world_events: Political intrigue was common.

text_english: So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.
world_events: Opposition to Islam was growing.

text_english: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
world_events: Polytheism was prevalent.

text_english: Who created and proportioned
world_events: Nature's harmony was observable.

text_english: And who destined and [then] guided
world_events: Animal instincts were observed.

text_english: And who brings out the pasture
world_events: Pastoral life was common.

text_english: And [then] makes it black stubble.
world_events: Seasonal changes affected vegetation.

text_english: We will make you recite, [O Muhammad], and you will not forget,
world_events: Oral tradition was primary.

text_arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعْلَمُ ٱلْجَهْرَ وَمَا يَخْفَىٰ
text_english: Except what Allah should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
world_events: Secret meetings were held.

text_english: And We will ease you toward ease.
world_events: Life was challenging for believers.

text_english: So remind, if the reminder should benefit;
world_events: Some were receptive to message.

text_english: He who fears [Allah] will be reminded.
world_events: Fear of divine was present.

text_english: But the wretched one will avoid it -
world_events: Some rejected the message.

text_english: He will emerge from the Fire, exhausted.
world_events: Fire was most feared punishment.

text_english: He will be fed, but with a little.
world_events: Food scarcity was common.

text_english: He will be thrown into a narrow place.
world_events: Desert heat was most feared punishment.

text_english: He will call out on that Day, 'Would that I had a helper!'
world_events: Tribal protection was vital.

text_english: I swear by this city -
context: Oath by Mecca, the sacred city.
world_events: Mecca was a significant trade center.

text_english: And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -
world_events: Prophet faced opposition in Mecca.

text_english: And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],
world_events: Family lineage was highly valued.

text_english: We have certainly created man into hardship.
world_events: Life was challenging in desert environment.

text_english: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
world_events: Major events were shared through reports.

text_english: [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
world_events: Facial expressions showed social status.

text_english: Working [hard] and exhausted,
world_events: Hard labor was common.

text_english: They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire,
world_events: Desert heat was well-known.

text_english: They will be given drink from a boiling spring.
world_events: Springs were vital water sources.

text_arabic: لَّيْسَ لَهُمْ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٍ
text_english: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant,
world_events: Desert had bitter plants.

text_arabic: لَّا يُسْمِنُ وَلَا يُغْنِى مِن جُوعٍ
text_english: Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
world_events: Nutrition was vital for survival.

text_english: [Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.
world_events: Contentment was visible on faces.

text_english: With their effort [they are] satisfied,
world_events: Work satisfaction was valued.

text_english: [They will be] in an elevated garden,
world_events: Gardens were rare in desert.

text_english: Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.
world_events: Verbal disputes were common.

text_english: Within it is a flowing spring,
world_events: Flowing water was precious.

text_english: Within it are raised couches
world_events: Elevated seating showed status.

text_english: And cups put in place
world_events: Drinking vessels were important.

text_english: And cushions lined up
world_events: Cushions were luxury items.

text_english: And carpets spread around.
world_events: Carpets were signs of wealth.

text_arabic: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلْإِبِلِ كَيْفَ خُلِقَتْ
text_english: Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?
world_events: Camels were vital for survival.

text_english: And at the sky - how it is raised?
world_events: Sky observation was common.

text_english: And at the mountains - how they are erected?
world_events: Mountains were navigation markers.

text_english: And at the earth - how it is spread out?
world_events: Flat terrain dominated Arabia.

text_english: So remind, [O Muhammad]; you are only a reminder.
world_events: Reminders were part of oral tradition.

text_english: You are not over them a controller.
world_events: Tribal leaders had authority.

text_english: However, he who turns away and disbelieves -
world_events: Some chose to reject message.

text_english: Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.
world_events: Punishment deterred wrongdoing.

text_english: Indeed, to Us is their return,
world_events: Return journeys were common.

text_english: Then indeed, upon Us is their account.
world_events: Merchants kept accounts.

text_english: By the dawn
world_events: Dawn marked daily activities.

text_english: And [by] ten nights
world_events: Nights had spiritual significance.

text_english: And [by] the even [number] and the odd
world_events: Numbers had mystical meaning.

text_english: And [by] the night when it passes
world_events: Night travel was common.

text_arabic: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
text_english: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?
world_events: Oaths were binding.

text_arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَٰنَنِ
text_english: He will say, 'Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life.'
world_events: Life preparation valued.
